Fixing “Dead” Sordins https://thinh.com.au/posts/fixing-dead-sordins/fixing-dead-sordins/ Sat, 11 Dec 2021 14:18:26 +1000
https://thinh.com.au/posts/fixing-dead-sordins/fixing-dead-sordins/ Sordin Supreme Pro-Xs The Problem Sordin Supreme series electronic hearing protectors / “earpro’s” can have an issue with their battery compartment leading to the user thinking the device has failed. Common symptoms include: Intermittent power before total lost of power/function during vibration or a lot of head movements. No power when batteries installed/fresh batteries are installed. Signs of corrosion with old batteries. Broken battery tab on the removal of old batteries.

ShareX https://thinh.com.au/posts/sharex/sharex/ Mon, 06 Dec 2021 12:23:21 +1000
https://thinh.com.au/posts/sharex/sharex/ ShareX - my preferred screenshot tool for Windows. I’m OS agnostic, but one of the programs I wish I had on all the computers I use would be ShareX. Years ago, ShareX originally for me was a more powerful replacement to the stock snipping tool on Windows, and something that I could get close to the built in screen capture tools on macOS through hotkeys. It has since surpassed being just my screenshot program, as it does so much more!
Customisable Parametric Spool https://thinh.com.au/posts/customisable-parametric-spool/customisable-parametric-spool/ Tue, 30 Nov 2021 12:00:36 +1000
https://thinh.com.au/posts/customisable-parametric-spool/customisable-parametric-spool/ 3D printed spool of wire. This is a customisable spool that I designed in OpenSCAD. You should be able to customise most aspects of the spool to fit your spooling needs. I’ve uploaded it to Thingiverse and it’s also available on my Github repo Originally I designed a non-customisable spool to share some solder wire for a friend, but quickly figured out this would be a good opportunity to design a customisable part that I could use to organise/share other items in my workshop such as cables, rope, foam tapes, and thread.
Commissioning Tool Bag Tour https://thinh.com.au/posts/commissioning-tool-bag-tour/commissioning-toolbag-tour/ Tue, 16 Nov 2021 16:06:52 +1000
https://thinh.com.au/posts/commissioning-tool-bag-tour/commissioning-toolbag-tour/ Personal Commissioning/Go Bag The last few jobs I did had me travel a fair bit, and as part of those trips I did lots of commissioning and installation work of low voltage and standalone electrical equipment (solar/battery) without work, or the site/client providing the tools. Due to the nature of some of the places I was travelling (MEA and SEA primarily), you really couldn’t guarantee what would be available on-site.
Trying Out Hugo https://thinh.com.au/posts/trying-out-hugo/trying-out-hugo/ Mon, 15 Nov 2021 15:41:53 +1000
https://thinh.com.au/posts/trying-out-hugo/trying-out-hugo/ This blog is using Hugo. It was pretty quick and easy to setup. My only previous static site generator experience was Jekyll. It is currently using the Tanka theme. This is subject to change as I dive deeper and will either modify it (likely) or switch it up completely. Hugo was selected because: Static sites are the fastest. Static means I can just host it for free on Github Pages - turns out blogging isn’t just limited to Jekyll.
About https://thinh.com.au/about/ Wed, 01 Jan 2020 00:00:00 +0000
https://thinh.com.au/about/ Hi, I’m Thinh, I’m a hardware and software engineer and this my personal website. I’ll mostly be posting random articles about personal projects I’m working on. Thanks for stopping by!
